summary.Title: Electrical Engineer (robotics)
summary.Presentation:
To grow our R&D team, we are looking for an Electrical Engineer to support the development of the next iteration of our first product. 
 
About Seasony  
Seaso

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
To grow our R&D team, we are looking for an Electrical Engineer to support the development of the next iteration of our first product. 

 

About Seasony  

Seasony helps vertical farms feed the world with less hassle and more automation.  

By automating the core processes in vertical farming with our modular autonomous mobile robot “Watney” we can offer vertical farms substantial reductions on labor costs and increase yields by increased monitoring. As Watney provides a platform for further automation we have created an open ecosystem for module development, that provides a one-size fits all solution for vertical farms.  

 

About the position 

You will work with our mobile robot consisting of a mobile platform, a lift, and a modular top platform and develop new features for autonomous operation in a vertical farming environment.   

You will be responsible, in coordination with other team members, of all the embedded electronics of the robot, this ranges from the complex electronics such as the computer to the simplest ones such as the buttons, going through the motors, the controllers, the batteries, the communication busses, the wires, the cables, and so on. You will also work with the firmware of the different components, to ensure all communication between the sensor and the “brain” of the robot work properly.  

 

This position is about the design of electrical systems, based on needs that can be dynamic given the early stage of development and the nature of the work. In a daily basis you will be: 

  • Working closely with the team (from different background: prototyping, software, mechanical, …) to conceptualize, specify, and implement electrical architectures 

  • Designing electrical schematics in a CAD software – AutoCAD electrical, Solidwork Electrical, or similar), and generating the relevant documentation for assembly. 

  • Specifying and selecting components to integrate in the electrical system 

  • Helping in the assembly of the electrical components of the system. 

  • Optimizing both quality, space, and price of the overall system 

  • Analyzing and debugging systems, both before and after deployment 

  • Working with low voltage and high-power devices, such as batteries, motors, and so on. 

  • Working with third parties to ensure CE, ISO, and EN compliance 

  • Utilize Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) tools to maintain design specifications, bill of materials, supporting documentation, and lifecycle control of electrical subsystems. 

     

About you: 

  • Minimum BSEE and 3+ years of industry experience in a professional and product-driven environment 

  • Experience in one or more of the following: robotics, automation, embedded controls, high-speed differential signaling, microcontrollers, memory buses, digital design, power electronics 

  • Passion for robotics and curiosity for electronics in high-reliability applications  

  • Experience with testing and system integration 

  • Experience with developing fundamentally new hardware, not just incrementally updating legacy hardware 

  • Experience with automating hardware development functions (e.g., scripting to control benchtop equipment or to accelerate analysis or simulation) 

  • Excellent English verbal and written communication skills 

 

We offer:  

  • An attractive job in a small and agile team 

  • A workplace in an innovation hub in BETAFACTORY in South Habour, Copenhagen  

  • Responsibilities from day one and a big impact on how the technology is developed 

  • A flexible workplace with a versatile team 

  • A team that takes pride and enjoys the craft that is engineering 

  • Opportunities to quickly grow personally and professionally in a fast-paced environment 

  • A great selection of snacks & refreshments on-site
